description: {"blocks":[{"key":"d6pjp","text":"This protocol details how to monitor Clusterin binding to the Very Low-Density Lipoprotein Receptor (VLDLR) by Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assays (ELISA) adapted from Leeb et al. (2014).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Solid phase binding assay - Clusterin binding to Very Low-Density Lipoprotein Receptor (VLDLR)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2jto3","text":"Coat the corresponding wells of a 96-well plate (Nunc-Immuno MicroWell 96 well solid plate, MERCK) with   of TBS-C containing   VLDLR ectodomain   at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":104,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":126,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":145,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":150,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1q2r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bqg0k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1621}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4lieq","text":"The same number of wells should be incubated with TBS-C without VLDLR. These wells will be used as ligand background binding (addition of ligand to wells without immobilized receptor).","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

The wells without receptor are now coated with BSA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":49,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":54,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"do5je","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

steps.section: Solid phase binding assay - Clusterin binding to Very Low-Density Lipoprotein Receptor (VLDLR)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5hug0","text":"Remove Blocking solution and apply a series of increasing concentrations of ligand diluted in Blocking solution, each in a final volume of  . Each ligand concentration should be added to one well with immobilized VLDLR and one well coated with BSA (Blocking solution) for ligand background binding. One well with VLDLR and one well coated with BSA should be incubated without ligand to determine the general plate background signal.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":139,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"948n2","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8p5pr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"26eg1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"75q22","text":"For Clusterin, a concentration range from 50 nM to 10000 nM is recommended (approximate KD = 80-140 nM). ","type":"unordered-list-item"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"98edm","text":"Low Density Lipoprotein-Related Protein-Associated Protein 1 (LRPAP1 or RAP) is a molecular chaperone for LDL receptor-related proteins and therefore it can be use as positive control and as a competitor binder. For RAP binding, a concentration range from 1 nM to 60 nM is recommended (approximate KD = 1-2 nM). For competition assays, mix a fixed concentration of the ligand with increasing concentrations of the competitor (RAP).","type":"unordered-list-item"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}
